revised_title: Influence of Higher-Order Terms on the Dielectric Constant of Ionic Crystals
tldr: The authors investigate the influence of higher-order terms in the dielectric constant of ionic crystals, specifically the anharmonic terms in the potential energy and the higher-order terms in the dipole moment. They find that these terms contribute to the static dielectric constant and can affect the infra-red absorption spectrum. The study suggests that the long-range dipolar interactions between the first- and second-order moments may be responsible for the variations in the intensity and width of the infra-red bands in ionic crystals.
